item.title: Embryo Experiments Reveal Earliest Human Development, But Stir Ethical Debate
item.description: March 2, 2017 - Researchers who study developing human embryos have long limited their experimentation to lab embryos that are no more than 14 days into development. Some scientists are now pushing that boundary.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - Researchers who study developing human embryos have long limited their experimentation to lab embryos that are no more than 14 days into development. Some scientists are now pushing that boundary. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/02/516280895/embryo-experiments-reveal-earliest-human-development-but-stir-ethical-debate

item.title: Birth Control Is Working Better – Or At Least, It's Failing Less
item.description: March 1, 2017 - Failure rates for the most common forms of contraception are down, but it's not entirely clear whether it's due to education, availability, or other reasons.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - Failure rates for the most common forms of contraception are down, but it's not entirely clear whether it's due to education, availability, or other reasons. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/01/518000283/your-birth-control-is-working-better-or-at-least-failing-less

item.title: This Tiny Patch Of Mold Cost One Lucky Buyer Nearly $15,000
item.description: March 1, 2017 - On the mold market — which is a thing, apparently — this bit of green is a "holy relic": some of the mold that helped Alexander Fleming discover penicillin. And it sold for big bucks at auction.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - On the mold market — which is a thing, apparently — this bit of green is a "holy relic": some of the mold that helped Alexander Fleming discover penicillin. And it sold for big bucks at auction. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/01/517979196/this-tiny-patch-of-mold-cost-one-lucky-buyer-nearly-15-000

item.title: At Texas Clinic, 2 Women Explain What Changed Their Minds On Abortion
item.description: March 1, 2017 - Since the election of Donald Trump, the abortion debate has been ramping up. At one clinic in Texas, two women on opposite sides recently changed their minds about how they view abortion.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - Since the election of Donald Trump, the abortion debate has been ramping up. At one clinic in Texas, two women on opposite sides recently changed their minds about how they view abortion. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/01/517988090/at-texas-clinic-2-women-explain-what-changed-their-minds-on-abortion

item.title: Michigan Ends Water Subsidies To Flint Despite Mayor's Opposition
item.description: March 1, 2017 - The city's crisis over lead-laced water dates back to 2014, and the state has paid more than $40 million in credits for the unsafe water in an effort to ease the burden for residents.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - The city's crisis over lead-laced water dates back to 2014, and the state has paid more than $40 million in credits for the unsafe water in an effort to ease the burden for residents. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/01/517932477/michigan-ends-water-subsidies-to-flint-despite-mayors-opposition

item.title: Targeting The Immune System May Help Stop The Itch Of Eczema
item.description: March 1, 2017 - About 35 million people have eczema, a skin disease that includes itchy patches of inflamed dry skin. About 10 percent of cases are moderate to severe and may be helped with a new treatment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - About 35 million people have eczema, a skin disease that includes itchy patches of inflamed dry skin. About 10 percent of cases are moderate to severe and may be helped with a new treatment. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/01/517933633/targeting-the-immune-system-may-help-stop-the-itch-of-eczema

item.title: Trump Outlines Plan For Health Care In Address To Congress
item.description: March 1, 2017 - In his first address to a joint session of Congress, President Trump outlined his plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, which has long been a rallying cry for the Republican Party. But how realistic is it? NPR takes a closer look at the president's proposal to overhaul the health care system.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - In his first address to a joint session of Congress, President Trump outlined his plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, which has long been a rallying cry for the Republican Party. But how realistic is it? NPR takes a closer look at the president's proposal to overhaul the health care system. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/01/517988149/trump-outlines-plan-for-health-care-in-address-to-congress

item.title: Despite Continued Water Safety Fears, Michigan Ends Subsidies For Flint
item.description: March 1, 2017 - The state of Michigan is ending subsidies for water costs for Flint residents. The state says the water is now safe to drink after an ongoing water crisis. But the mayor and many residents disagree.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - The state of Michigan is ending subsidies for water costs for Flint residents. The state says the water is now safe to drink after an ongoing water crisis. But the mayor and many residents disagree. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/01/517988171/despite-continued-water-safety-fears-michigan-ends-subsidies-for-flint

item.title: Kentucky Residents Fear Consequences Of Obamacare Repeal
item.description: March 1, 2017 - Kentucky was one of the states that embraced the Affordable Care Act. Residents talk about their experiences with the law and how a potential repeal might affect them.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - Kentucky was one of the states that embraced the Affordable Care Act. Residents talk about their experiences with the law and how a potential repeal might affect them. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/01/517988156/kentucky-residents-fear-consequences-of-obamacare-repeal

item.title: A Husband Loses His 'Best Friend' — Salome Karwah, Ebola Hero
item.description: March 1, 2017 - She survived the virus and made the cover of Time magazine as an 'Ebola fighter.' Now she's dead at 28, leaving behind a husband and their four young children.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - She survived the virus and made the cover of Time magazine as an 'Ebola fighter.' Now she's dead at 28, leaving behind a husband and their four young children. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/01/515822228/a-husband-loses-his-best-friend-salome-karwah-ebola-hero

item.title: Just How Much Pee Is In That Pool?
item.description: March 1, 2017 - Scientists have now identified an easy way to measure pool urine—by looking for traces of a common artificial sweetener. Urine in pools mixed with chemicals can pose a potential health threat.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - Scientists have now identified an easy way to measure pool urine—by looking for traces of a common artificial sweetener. Urine in pools mixed with chemicals can pose a potential health threat. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/01/517785902/just-how-much-pee-is-in-that-pool

item.title: Some See 'Flat-Fee Primary Care' As A GOP-Friendly Way To Provide Routine Care
item.description: March 1, 2017 - In "direct primary care," a model favored by HHS Secretary Tom Price, patients pay a monthly fee to doctors for basic health care. But does that really provide better value?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - In "direct primary care," a model favored by HHS Secretary Tom Price, patients pay a monthly fee to doctors for basic health care. But does that really provide better value? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/01/517761293/some-see-flat-fee-primary-care-as-a-gop-friendly-way-to-provide-routine-care

item.title: Trump Moves Toward Traditional Republican Health Care Plans
item.description: March 1, 2017 - President Trump doubled down on his pledge to quickly repeal and replace Obamacare. He talked about the longtime Republican idea of having health insurers sell insurance across state lines.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 1, 2017 - President Trump doubled down on his pledge to quickly repeal and replace Obamacare. He talked about the longtime Republican idea of having health insurers sell insurance across state lines. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/01/517882208/trump-moves-toward-traditional-republican-health-care-plans

item.title: What If You Could Take It With You? Health Insurance, That Is
item.description: February 28, 2017 - A key part of GOP plans to reform health care may include making health care more portable. But it's not so easy to do.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 28, 2017 - A key part of GOP plans to reform health care may include making health care more portable. But it's not so easy to do. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/28/517720563/what-if-you-could-take-it-with-you-health-insurance-that-is

item.title: 'River On Fire' Explores Genius, Madness And The Poetry Of Robert Lowell
item.description: February 28, 2017 - Kay Redfield Jamison's new book describes how Lowell's manic-depressive illness influenced his life and work. "His manias tended to lead him into writing a fresh kind of poetry," she says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 28, 2017 - Kay Redfield Jamison's new book describes how Lowell's manic-depressive illness influenced his life and work. "His manias tended to lead him into writing a fresh kind of poetry," she says. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/28/517706249/river-on-fire-explores-genius-madness-and-the-poetry-of-robert-lowell
